intro: Bombacopsis rurrenabaqueana, commonly known as the Rurrenabaque trumpet tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to the Amazon rainforest of Bolivia. It is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 15 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grey bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange, which bloom in clusters during the dry season. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in the local ecosystem.
